Clipbox

clipbox allows for rendering an object outside of its maximum or minimum rending area, if a width and height are given to a list of objects. This is useful for objects that fall beyond the maximum or minimum render area, at the cost of higher memory usage.

   MyObject:{ w: 50, h: 100, rect: true, clipbox: true, boundsMargin: [100, 100, 100, 100] }

boundsMargin

Lightning uses a default boundsMargin of 100px to detect images around the edges. boundsMargin defines where the textures start loading before entering the render area.

NameTypeDefaultDescription
boundsMarginArray[100,100,100,100]Values in order left, top, right and bottom.

If clipbox is true, which is the default value, objects outside the maximum rendering area will turn invisible to save memory. While the opposite, setting clipbox to false, allows the rendering to continue even if the object is out side its maximum or minimum rendering area. This can come in handy when trying to scroll through a long list of elements which need to stay rendered.

Below an example of how clipbox works. Try turning clipbox on and off, then press left or right to see what happens.

class BasicUsageExample extends lng.Application {
    static _template() {
        return {
            //Try setting clipbox to true and false to see what happens.
            //Then press right or left to move the list.
            List:{ w: 50, h: 50, x: 100, clipbox: false }
        };
    }
     
    _init(){
        this._totalListItems = 200;
        this._listItems = [];
        for(let i = 0; i < this._totalListItems; i++){
            this._listItems.push({ myData: 'data' });
        }
        this.tag('List').children = this._listItems.map((data, idx)=>{
            return {  src: '/Lightning-SDK/img/LngDocs_LilLightningIdle.png', x: idx * 150, y: 50 };
        });
     }
     
     _handleLeft(){
        this.tag('List').patch({ smooth:{ x: 100 }});
     }
     
     _handleRight(){
        this.tag('List').patch({ smooth:{ x: [-(this._totalListItems*120), { duration: 2, timingFunction: 'linear' } ] }});  
     }
}


const options = {stage: {w: window.innerWidth, h: window.innerHeight, clearColor: 0x00000000, canvas2d: false, useImageWorker: false}, debug: true};
options.keys = {
    38: "Up",
    40: "Down",
    37: "Left",
    39: "Right",
    13: "Enter",
    9: "Back",
    8: "Back",
    93: "Back",
    174: "Back",
    175: "Menu",
    83: "Search"
};
const app = new BasicUsageExample(options);
document.body.appendChild(app.stage.getCanvas());
